content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a hotel in Rome with a good rating (7 or above) that offers free cancellation and breakfast included, for a three-night stay from May 28 to May 31, 2026, for two adults.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The first step is to enter "Rome" as the destination in the "Where are you going?" textbox to start searching for hotels in Rome.
Action: Type [14]; Rome
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The check-in and check-out dates required are May 28–31, 2026. The current calendar is showing September and October 2025, so I need to move the calendar forward to reach May 2026. Clicking the "Next month" button will advance the calendar one month at a time.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to get to May 2026 on the calendar to choose the correct check-in and check-out dates. I should keep clicking the "Next month" button to move the calendar forward.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still need to reach May 2026 on the calendar. I should continue clicking the "Next month" button to advance through more months.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now showing December 2025 and January 2026. I need to reach May 2026, so I should continue clicking the "Next month" button multiple times until May 2026 appears.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.22
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is at February 2026. I need to proceed to May 2026, so I should keep clicking the "Next month" button.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.24
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently displaying February and March 2026. I need to keep moving forward to reach May 2026, so I have to keep clicking the "Next month" button.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.26

Thought: The calendar is now showing March and April 2026. I still haven't reached May 2026, so I need to continue clicking the "Next month" button.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows May 2026. I need to select the check-in date as May 28 (label 87) and the check-out date as May 31 (label 90). I will start by selecting May 28 as the check-in date.
Action: Click [87]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have already selected May 28, 2026, as the check-in date. Now I need to select May 31, 2026, as the check-out date to complete the 3-night stay.
Action: Click [90]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The correct dates and number of guests have been selected. Now, before reviewing hotels, I must apply filters for "Free cancellation" and "Breakfast included" to meet all requirements. These filter options are likely available in the filter section, which is not fully visible. I should scroll down to see more filter options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The filter section on the left is visible, but I do not yet see filters for "Free cancellation" or "Breakfast included." I need to scroll down further to find these options so I can apply the required hotel filters.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see the "Facilities" section, but not all facilities are shown. There may be options like "Free cancellation" and "Breakfast included" hidden in the extended filter list. I should click "Show all 13" (label 24) to expand the facilities and reveal additional filters.
Action: Click [24]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The expanded "Facilities" section still does not reveal filters for "Free cancellation" or "Breakfast included." These options may be further down or in a different section (e.g., "Breakfast included" might appear under amenities or meal options). I should scroll down to continue searching for these filters.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.68
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Review score" filter is now visible, and I see an option for "Good: 7+" (label 26) which matches the rating requirement. However, I still need to find filters for "Free cancellation" and "Breakfast included." These may be further down the filter section. I should scroll down to search for the remaining filters.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible filters are for neighborhoods and room facilities, but there are still no options for "Free cancellation" or "Breakfast included." "Show all 25" (label 46) under room facilities might reveal additional filters—possibly including "Breakfast included." I should click it to display more options and check if the necessary filters appear.
Action: Click [46]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.72
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The expanded "Room facilities" section still doesn't show "Breakfast included" or "Free cancellation" filters. More filters or the needed options could be further down the page. I should continue scrolling down to look for these essential booking options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.74
